messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OT- need reply from Californian
messages.msgSnippet:
mrsmattie@aol.com wrote:
 
 Rachel asked:-
 
 I m looking for an ISP in So Calif that doesn t require
 HSLDA insurance.
  Can you refer me anywhere?
messages.messageBody:
mrsmattie@... wrote:
>
> Rachel asked:-
>
> >I'm looking for an ISP in So Calif that doesn't require
> HSLDA insurance.
> > Can you refer me anywhere?
>
Silly me I still think of "internet service provider"
When I was living in southern cali I went to Laurel Springs
School for my last year of "high school" They pretty much
have it covered, homeschool, classes you can attend there
(in ojai) and internet courses. Without a doubt it was the
best school I ever went to.
http://www.laurelsprings.com/
I don't know about the HSLDA insurance but I don't remember
any mention of it.

Mara Arlene
momma to Cleopatra (03/19/98) and Thony (09/26/00)
http://members.nettrash.com/blackthorn
-- an idiot proof society breeds idiots. -- unknown

messages.subject: OT- need reply from Californian
messages.msgSnippet: Rachel asked:- ... A lady called Leonore, one of the former regulars in the AOL homeschooling forum, runs a private ISP in Southern California. I think it
messages.messageBody:
Rachel asked:-

>I'm looking for an ISP in So Calif that doesn't require HSLDA insurance.
> Can you refer me anywhere?

A lady called Leonore, one of the former regulars in the AOL homeschooling
forum, runs a private ISP in Southern California. I think it unlikely that
her ISP requires HSLDA membership.

Her email address is:- bayshoredu@...

There's also a web site for the ISP:-

http://www.bayshoreeducational.com/BayShoreSchool.html

Mattie (in northern California)
